summary: John R. Tunheim was a member of the Assassination Records Review Board (ARRB). The documents highlight his involvement in overseeing the declassification and release of JFK assassination records. He played a role in requesting additional information from the CIA, addressing concerns about the pace of declassification, and making formal determinations regarding the public disclosure of CIA records related to the assassination. His work involved interacting with the CIA's Historical Review Group (HRG) and Director of Central Intelligence George Tenet, as well as dealing with issues related to protecting covert employees' identities and ongoing intelligence operations while ensuring transparency.
significance: John R. Tunheim's significance lies in his role as a member of the ARRB, which was responsible for ensuring the declassification and release of JFK assassination records. He was directly involved in requesting information from the CIA, addressing concerns about the pace of declassification, and making formal determinations regarding the public disclosure of CIA records related to the assassination. His work was crucial in balancing transparency with national security concerns.
